title: Honoring Joseph Lauro upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Joseph Lauro upon the occasion of his
designation for special recognition by the Federation of  Italian-Ameri-
can Organizations of Brooklyn, Ltd.

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are  reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those individ-
uals who devote themselves to the welfare of the community and its citi-
zenry; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor  Joseph  Lauro
upon  the  occasion  of  his  designation for special recognition by the
Federation of Italian-American Organizations of Brooklyn,  Ltd.,  to  be
celebrated at its 34th Anniversary Gala on March 27, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  Joseph  Lauro  is  a Registered Architect and a Principal at
Gensler one of the world's largest Architectural Design  Firms;  Gensler
is  a diverse firm providing design services for the full array of busi-
ness around the world; Gensler provides their expertise through 14 Prac-
tice Areas, Mr. Lauro leads the  Mission  Critical  Facilities  Practice
Area internationally; and
  WHEREAS,  In addition to leading a Practice Area at Gensler, Mr. Lauro
is a Technical Director responsible for  technical  excellence,  quality
assurance  and design development in the North East Region; he leads the
North East Region Education Group responsible for  the  staff  education
programs that are meant to provide training, mentorship and professional
development for young architects; and
  WHEREAS,  A  pioneer  in the sustainable building design movement, Mr.
Lauro was part of the early class of design professionals  to  become  a
LEED  Accredited  Professional,  a  certification from the United States
Green Building Council; as a LEED professional,  he  developed  training
programs to teach professionals the fundamentals of the LEED Program and
the  basics required for professional accreditation; in 2005, he was the
Architect for the world's first LEED Certified Data Center/Office Build-
ing for Fannie Mae in Urbana, Maryland; and
  WHEREAS, Joseph Lauro has led the design team that is responsible  for
"Il  Centro"  the  first  Italian  American Community Center; as a proud
Italian American, who was born in Mola de  Bari,  Italy  and  raised  in
Brooklyn,  he  has led the success of the FIAO team with an unparalleled
passion matched only by the FIAO team; and
  WHEREAS, Joseph Lauro graduated from the New York Institute  of  Tech-
nology  with a bachelor's degree in Architecture; he is an active member
of the American Institute  of  Architects,  Urban  Land  Institute,  The
Construction  Specification  Institute,  The National Trust for Historic
Preservation, United States Green Building Council and The  Green  Grid;
and
  WHEREAS, Joseph Lauro is married to Jennifer and they are blessed with
two  beautiful children, DiAnna and Giovanni; the Lauro family has their
roots in Brooklyn and continues to provide support to the community; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their
profession, certainly have earned the recognition and  applause  of  all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Joseph Lauro upon the occasion  of  his  designation  for  special
recognition  by  the  Federation  of  Italian-American  Organizations of
Brooklyn, Ltd.; and be it further

  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Joseph Lauro.
